009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * This class implements the CIELab color space.
021 * See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for additional details.
022 * All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
023 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
024 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile 
025 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
026 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
027 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
028 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2022/09/01
036 */
037@SuppressWarnings("serial")
038public class LabColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
039        
040        private static final LabColorSpace instance = new LabColorSpace();
041        
042        public static LabColorSpace getInstance() {
043                return instance;
044        }
045
046        // D65 reference white point:
047//      private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
048//      private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
049//      private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
050        private static final double[] XYZref = D65.getXYZ();
051
052        // chromatic adaptation objects:
053        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(D65, D50);
054        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(D50, D65);
055
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor.
059         */
060        private LabColorSpace() {
061                super(TYPE_Lab, 3);
062        }
063
064        // XYZ50 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D50)
065        /**
066         * Converts color points in D50-based XYZ space to CIELab coordinates.
067         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#fromCIEXYZ(float[])}), assuming that 
068         * the specified color coordinate is in D50-based XYZ space (with components in [0,1]).
069         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
070         * 
071         * @param XYZ50 a color in D50-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
072         * @return the associated CIELab color
073         */
074        @Override
075        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
076                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);     
077                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
078        }
079
080        // XYZ65 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D65)
081        /**
082         * Converts color points in D65-based XYZ space to CIELab coordinates.
083         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])}.
084         * @param XYZ65 a color in D65-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
085         * @return the associated CIELab color
086         */
087        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
088                double xx = f1(XYZ65[0] / XYZref[0]);   
089                double yy = f1(XYZ65[1] / XYZref[1]);
090                double zz = f1(XYZ65[2] / XYZref[2]);
091                float L = (float)(116.0 * yy - 16.0);
092                float a = (float)(500.0 * (xx - yy));
093                float b = (float)(200.0 * (yy - zz));
094                return new float[] {L, a, b};
095        }
096
097        // CIELab -> XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Lab
098        /**
099         * Converts the specified CIELab color to D50-based XYZ coordinates.
100         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#toCIEXYZ(float[])}) assuming that
101         * the XYZ color coordinate is D50-based.
102         * See also {@link #toCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
103         * @param Lab CIELab color
104         * @return XYZ coordinates (D50-based)
105         */
106        @Override
107        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Lab) {
108                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
109                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
110        }
111
112        // CIELab -> XYZ65: returns XYZ values (relative to D65) from Lab
113        /**
114         * Converts the specified CIELab color to D65-based XYZ coordinates.
115         * @param Lab CIELab color
116         * @return XYZ coordinates (D65-based)
117         */
118        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Lab) {
119                double ll = ( Lab[0] + 16.0 ) / 116.0;
120                float Y65 = (float) (XYZref[1] * f2(ll));
121                float X65 = (float) (XYZref[0] * f2(ll + Lab[1] / 500.0));
122                float Z65 = (float) (XYZref[2] * f2(ll - Lab[2] / 200.0));
123                return new float[] {X65, Y65, Z65};
124        }
125
126        //sRGB -> CIELab (direct, without adaptation to D50)
127        /**
128         * Transforms a sRGB color value to a CIELab color.
129         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#fromRGB(float[])} assuming
130         * D65-based sRGB color coordinates.
131         * @param srgb a sRGB color (D65-based)
132         * @return the associated CIELab color
133         */
134        @Override
135        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
136                float[] XYZ65 = sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance().toCIEXYZ(srgb);  // TODO: use sRgb65ColorSpace singleton
137                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
138        }
139
140        //CIELab -> sRGB (direct, without adaptation to D50)
141        /**
142         * Transforms a CIELab color value to a sRGB color
143         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#toRGB(float[])} assuming 
144         * D65-based sRGB color coordinates.
145         * @param Lab a CIELab color
146         * @return sRGB coordinates (D65-based)
147         */
148        @Override
149        public float[] toRGB(float[] Lab) {
150                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
151                float[] srgb = sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance().fromCIEXYZ(XYZ65); // TODO: use sRgb65ColorSpace singleton
152                return srgb;
153        }
154
155        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
156
157        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
158        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
159
160        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
161        private double f1 (double c) {
162                return (c > epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
163        }
164
165        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
166        private double f2 (double c) {
167                double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
168                return (c3 > epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
169        }
170
171}
